item.description:
Revels acclaimed 40-member ensemble, Revels Repertory Company, brings the story of American immigration to life through music and song in this original 90-minute stage production that finds Italians, Irish and Eastern European Jews on a crowded passenger ship bound for America in 1907, at the height of American immigration.   

Sharing their music and songs, their dances and their dreams, the diverse group of travelers become one as they leave their homelands - but not their cultures - behind, in search of a better life in America, the land of hope and promise.

Written and directed by Patrick Swanson; Kay Dunlap, music director.

"An American Journey" is sponsored in part by the Massachusetts Cultural Council, a state agency, theWatertown Cultural Council and the New England Historic Genealogical Society.   

Join us for a free pre-performance talk at 2:30pm, "Researching Your Family History" by Rhonda R. McClure of the NEHGS.   Doors will open at 2:15pm. Come at 2. 15 if you'd like to hear the talk!

Tickets (General Admission): $20 adults; $12 children 11 and under

Join us for dinner or a drink after the show!

Please pay on-line via Paypal if you want to sit as a group. I charge $1 for the Meetup Fee plus $1 for the Paypal fee. BUT IF 10 people sign up we get discount and I'l give you a partial refund!  (Alternatively, you could buy your own ticket from the Revels website and just meet after the show. )

Sorry for the last minute-ness. My friend Liz is in this show and will join us afterwards!
